assignment3

Class Ladder

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment3.Ladder

  • public class Ladder
extends java.lang.Object
    Ladder class creates the head of a graph using the Node class that will contain and methods to solve a word ladder problem. This ladder contains the methods to solve the word ladder both recursively (DFS: findLadderDFS()) and using a priority queue (BFS: findLadderBFS()).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ladder

        public Ladder(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> dict,
              java.lang.String start,
              java.lang.String end)
        Takes in a dictionary Set (all unique Strings) and creates an ArrayList out of it so that it is easier to manage. The beginning and end of the word ladder are passed in and are set as the member's variables and a new head node is created.
        Parameters:
        dict - is a Set object that contains all unique Strings
        start - is a String that is the beginning of a word ladder
        end - is a String that is the end of a word ladder
        See Also:
        Node

    • Method Detail

      • findLadderBFS

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> findLadderBFS()
        Implementation of the Breadth First Search using a priority queue. To reduce complexity, the graph of nodes is built layer by layer instead of all at once. Worst case complexity is O(n^2) due to the searching of all elements on the words list for a match for each element The queue is initialized with the head pointer, and inside the loop the queue is popped to see if it matches the end word. If not, the popped node has its child nodes populated to create the next layer in the tree and the words used are removed from circulation to be rid of duplicates. When the node that is popped is the end word, it will return via reverse tree traversal using the nodes back pointer and populate an ArrayList with the nodes String value, thus creating the return array and guaranteeing the shortest ladder. If no ladder is found, the queue will reach zero and deliver and empty array filled with the start and end word.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of the word ladder found

      • buildTree

        private void buildTree()
        Helper function to build an entire tree for DFS search. Implements a similar graph build as BFS

      • findLadderDFS

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> findLadderDFS()
        Implements a Depth first search of a word ladder graph. The graph is first built entirely and then traversed recursively using a helper function. The words are traversed using a stack, where the last word in is the first out is the word is not found and the function recurses backwards. If the word is found, the stack is untouched and returned containing the ladder. Worst case complexity is O(n^2).
        Returns:

      • findLadderDFSHelper

        private boolean findLadderDFSHelper(Node ptr,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> stack)
        Recursive helper function. Tree will recurse until the node's pointer list is empty which wither occurs due to a word having no matches or if the tree has been thoroughly recursed and the nodes removed so that the same path isn't taken again
        Parameters:
        ptr - is the node that was a child and becomes the parent node
        stack - is the ArrayList that contains the Strings that will become the returned word ladder
        Returns:
        a boolean if the word ladder is found.
